SENT.plain: There are various causes of splenic infarction
Antiphospholipid antibody is associated with numerous thromboembolic phenomena
We report a case of young male who presented with acute abdominal pain and was diagnosed as a case of splenic infarction and acute pancreatitis with antiphospholipid syndrome
He was positive for anticardiolipin antibody, showed splenic infarction on abdominal CT scan
The patient's clinical, laboratory and imaging finding were consistent with splenic infarction and acute pancreatitis associated with antiphospholipid syndrome
